item.title: Martha add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Martha add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Martha add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Martha add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Martha add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Martha add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Martha add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Martha add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Martha add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "If you had to identify, in one word, the reason why the human race has not achieved, and never will achieve, its full potential, that word would be 'meetings." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Martha add a quote by Margery Allingham
item.description: "She rose and followed her bust from the room." -- Margery Allingham

item.title: Martha add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "I believe it was Shakespeare, or possibly Howard Cosell, who first observed that marriage is very much like a birthday candle, in that 'the flames of passion burn brightest when the wick of intimacy is first ignited by the disposable butane lighter of physical attraction, but sooner or later the heat of familiarity causes the wax of boredom to drip all over the vanilla frosting of novelty and the shredded coconut of romance.' I could not have phrased it better myself." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Martha add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "It is a well-documented fact that guys will not ask for directions. This is a biological thing. This is why it takes several million sperm cells... to locate a female egg, despite the fact that the egg is, relative to them, the size of Wisconsin." -- Dave Barry

item.title: Martha add a quote by Dave Barry
item.description: "The problem with winter sports is that -- follow me closely here -- they generally take place in winter." -- Dave Barry
